title: Vladimir Markov (mathematician)
summary: Vladimir Andreyevich Markov (Russian: Влади́мир Андре́евич Ма́рков; May 8, 1871 – January 18, 1897) was a mathematician, known for proving the Markov brothers' inequality with his older brother Andrey Markov. He was from the Russian Empire. He died of tuberculosis at the age of 25.[1]
